actions

Actions are the basic elements of a flowchart (activity diagram), the building blocks. They are found within object methods or functions. Each action annotation refers to several lines of the code written below, basically until the next action annotation, or a relevant flow bifurcation.

annotation

      ...
      //$ do something
      //$ and other thing as well
      code

representation in the diagram

*width of the text before line return: a configurable option of the system (impacts on the aesthetics).
See also Actions_modifiers.

examples


int class::activity_method(){

int a; 

//$ do something
//$ and other thing as well
//*************************
// we print using std::cout
std::cout << "do 1"<< endl;
std::cout << "do 2"<< endl;

return 0;
}
      

      
int class::activity_method(){

int a; 

//$ do something
//$ and other thing as well

// we print using std::cout
std::cout << "do 1"<< endl;
std::cout << "do 2"<< endl;

return 0;
}
      
      
int class::activity_method(){

int a; 

//$ do something
// we print using std::cout
std::cout << "do 1"<< endl;

//$ do other thing
std::cout << "do 2"<< endl;

return 0;
}
